DataElement.preferredName: Surgery Procedure Post-Operative Fever Intravenous Antibiotic Complication Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to post-operative surgery complication of an abnormal elevation of body temperature, usually as a result of a pathologic process which requires administration within or into a vein or veins of a drug used to treat infections caused by bacteria and other microorganisms.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Surgery Procedure Post-Operative Fever Intravenous Antibiotic Complication
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to post-operative surgery complication of an abnormal elevation of body temperature, usually as a result of a pathologic process which requires administration within or into a vein or veins of a drug used to treat infections caused by bacteria and other microorganisms.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Property.preferredName: Post-Operative Fever Intravenous Route of Administration Antibiotic Complication
Property.preferredDefinition: Post-Operative; relating to or occurring during the period immediately following a surgical operation.:Fever, also known as pyrexia, is the elevation of the body's temperature above the upper limit of normal, usually taken as 37.7 degrees C.  Most fevers are caused by infections and almost all infectious diseases cause fever. (Wikipedia):Administration within or into a vein or veins.:(an-tih-by-AH-tik) A drug used to treat infections caused by bacteria and other microorganisms.:Complication; any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of (or because of) another disease.

Concepts.definition: Post-Operative; relating to or occurring during the period immediately following a surgical operation.
Elevation of body temperature above normal due to inflammatory or immune responses.

Administration of a drug within or into a vein or veins. Introduction of the drug directly into venous circulation results in 100% bioavailability due to an absence of the absorption phase, provides a precise and continuous mode of drug therapy, especially for drugs with a narrow therapeutic index.

Substances naturally produced by microorganisms or their derivatives that selectively target microorganisms not humans. Antibiotics kill or inhibit the growth of microorganisms by targeting components of the microbial cell absent from human cells, including bacterial cell walls, cell membrane, and 30S or 50S ribosomal subunits. These substances are used in the treatment of bacterial and other microbial infections.
Any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of, or because of, another disease, treatment, or procedure.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

DataElementConcept.origin: GOG CRF:Gynecologic Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
